roleset.name: satiate to the point of loathing
roleset.note: CLOY-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on ULA. Member of VNcls amuse-31.1. Partial comparison to 'satisfy'. (from cloy.01-v)

example.name: intransitive
example.text: In part , that is attributable to the designation of his correspondents , who keep him informed on language that is not within earshot , as the ? Lexicographic Irregulars , ? an amusing reference the first time or two it-1 was used [*-1]-2 but now beginning *PRO*-2 to cloy .

example.name: with experiencer
example.text: I played it several times and it was OK but after a while [the game]-1 sarted *PRO*-1 to cloy on me.

example.name: inanimate as arg1
example.text: The feel of wood was acrid and chalky in his mouth, metal was salt, stone tasted sour-sweet to the touch of his fingers, and the feel of glass cloyed his palate like over-rich pastry.

example.name: ergative, other usage
example.text: Yes it went on forever, and yes there were moments when-1 it cloyed with misplaced sentimentality *trace*-1

example.name: all args, inanimate arg0
example.text: His studies for the early History of Britain had cloyed him with legends conveyed from book to book.
example.arg: His studies for the early History of Britain
with legends conveyed from book to book

example.name: all args, animate arg0
example.text: The mother of his babyhood had cloyed him with fussiness, the mother of his childhood emasculated him.
